title: A happy crack
author: VD
content_html:
09-f9-11-02-9d-74-e3-5b-d8-41-56-c5-63-56-88-c0. But it’s nice to see that there’s at least one company that actually listens to its users:

You’d rather see Digg go down fighting than bow down to a bigger company. We hear you, and effective immediately we won’t delete stories or comments containing the code and will deal with whatever the consequences might be.

If we lose, then what the hell, at least we died trying.

It was a nice touch putting in the HD-DVD crack into the post title as well. Anyhow, this concept of a site owner being responsible in any way for information that other people put on it has got to go. It’s exactly like prosecuting the owner of a building for a hate crime because someone else spray-painted a swastika on it.

The “crime” is non-existent and the party being held liable isn’t responsible.
